paragraphs.name: a7b5
paragraphs.text: The design team or a “DLS team” might “own” the design system, it’s creation should be a team effort with a collective desire provide both a fantastic user experience while adding efficiency to internal processes through effective documentation and reusable components.

paragraphs.name: fe94
paragraphs.text: Craft by Invision Labs

paragraphs.name: 8eb6
paragraphs.text:
A point (pt) is a measurement of space that is dependent on screen resolution. The simplest explanation is that at a “1x” resolution (or @1x), 1pt = 1px.
At a “2x” resolution (@2x), 1pt = 4px because resolution doubles on both the X and Y axes making it 2px wide by 2px tall.
At a “3x” resolution (@3x), 1pt = 9px (3px x 3px) and so on.

paragraphs.name: 61da
paragraphs.text: When i build design systems i not only look on the library, but in how we work today, tool, design process, documentation, the whole ecosystem, otherwise you just cleaning the dusk and place it under.

Hi Alex, thank you, glad you like it.
I had problems before with empty spaces on the names, imagine an URL like this: Well,%20theoretically%20speaking, also i think is better organise with “no spaces”, but feel free to use spaces if you think is the best :)

8050a247049b.title: Thank you so much for the concise, systematic blueprint.

paragraphs.text: Thank you so much for the concise, systematic blueprint. Once architected, it can be used as an untouchable but upgradable parent-framework for any system. Then, go ahead and skin it, customize it, reuse it, theme it. You inspired me to design like a solution architect, reminding me about how important this is to start thinking patterns and beautiful order as early in the process as possible. Thanks again, Marco.
